alert.note: Alert for Pike; Scioto (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued February 22 at 4:24AM EST until February 26 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Wilmington
info.description: ...The Flood Warning continues for the following rivers... Scioto River at Piketon. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM EARLY THIS MORNING THROUGH SATURDAY AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Scioto River at Piketon. * WHEN...Until early Saturday afternoon. * IMPACTS...At 23.0 feet, Backwater flooding worsens along creeks flowing into the Scioto River. Stretches of several low-lying roads near the river are flooded. Scioto and Camp Creek Townships in southern Pike County experience the most significant flooding. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 3:00 AM EST Tuesday the stage was 18.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to begin rising later today and rise above flood stage late this evening and then crest at 22.6 feet Thursday morning. It will fall below flood stage Saturday morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. &&
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay tuned to developments by listening to NOAA Weather Radio. For additional details on river forecasts, visit water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=iln
